channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MA

item.title: Report E-2025020400
item.description:
Report E-2025020400

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-28T00:58:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-21
  • City: BEVERLY
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Veolia employees discovered a leaking 5-gallon carboy when they arrived at the customer location. The 5-gallon carboy was loaded at the previous pick up. Upon locating the leaking container, the employees discovered a screw was lodged in the carboy. The screw appeared to come from a loose panel in the back of the truck. A Veolia employee cleaned up the spill and notified Veolia EH&S. The hole was in the side of the jerrican facing the wall of the truck. A loose board had two screws sticking out of it. One the the screws punctured the jerrican and caused a leak. Duration of the release was about 15 minutes. A little less than half the contents leaked out of the jerrican. Employees overpacked the jerrican into another container and cleaned up the liquid that spilled inside the truck.

item.title: Report E-2025020352
item.description:
Report E-2025020352

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-04
  • City: NORTON
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EQ NORTHEAST, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: @ totes/IBCs, as described, loaded aboard van type trailer from pickup at Alnylam (Cambridge, MA) and enroute to Elizabeth, NJ. During loading stop at Alnylam (Norton, MA) driver conducted periodic check of load and discovered small liquid release on top of IBCs. Note, spillage remained on top of IBCs due to small qty of liquid leaked and product was cleaned up by our in-hours staff. New gaskets were used to replace existing gaskets that were on tank. Closures then tightened down to precise torque specifications from package manufacturer. Load continued to it's ultimate destination.

item.title: Report I-2025020015
item.description:
Report I-2025020015

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-23T00:59:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-28
  • City: Auburn
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Ross Express, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The freight was being unloaded at the Auburn, MA 'terminal. The drum of Methanol drums were being unloaded and during this process the forklift operator's forklift forks, punctured one drum of four being shipped. The methanol cleanup was performed after it was determined what the proper HM clean up procedure needed to be followed to protect Ross employees. The damaged drum and cleaning materials used for cleanup were placed in a recovery drum for disposal.
